title: Why did Riot think it was a good idea to give 8% damage buff on the first dragon kill?
body: I swear Riot didn't want their game to snowball.. Giving a 8% damage buff is retarded.. 9/10 the team that gets Dragon is the team with the winning bottom lane. That 8% buff makes it nearly impossible for a losing lane to come back.

The problem with that, is you're just shifting the power. Now instead of straight up damage, you're basically giving a team more gold first. Extra damage to minions and monsters means easier to farm means more gold. Now a team has a heavy gold advantage, which is arguably worse. 
Likewise, the damage to towers is placed near the end because this is the point when sieging and pushing are very very important. Giving it too early means that one team gets a chance to end the game much much faster.
Short of changing all the buffs, giving the damage first is actually the least of all the evils.

Perhaps but think about it like this
First of all +8% damage helps against minions too

While the +15% minion damage will HELP you CS better, it doesn't GUARANTEE you will CS better. If the opponent is really good at CSing he can probably CS your equal regardless. So there is no 100% promise of an advantage over your opponent

While you can kill creeps better, you are technically still equals when it comes to skirmishes and trades. It takes time to generate that additional gold from the CSing boost. 

There is still counterplay options for your opponent as they can still deny you from CSing, either by trading when you go to CS. Pushing hard and try to force tower to steal your CS, especially effective if they CC you when you go to CS.


+8% Damage on the other hand provides your entire team with an instant offense increase over your opponent that can be exploited in dozens of different ways. 

They can use that higher offense to win trades forcing you to back more often or use more potions. 
They can use it to push team fights and engagements in their favor to earn kills.
Kills which I remind you not only provides your opponent with gold, but also denies you of gold while you are dead.
They can use it to siege your towers faster, killing them quicker than before.
Wrong. Giving more damage vs minions actually throws off their last hits. Which would be interesting to see, as that would be a real test of skill.

This is my logic behind it. Not gonna say it won't make a difference in high level play, but an extra 16 damage when you already have 200 isn't gonna make much of a difference to most I would think.
It increases your AD and AP by 8% technically. That's actually pretty huge especially on champs that have multiple scalings(Kat ult for example, or Veigar ult)

It still only increases the scaling damage by 8%. It's a lot on burst champions, because it lets them kill people who have a little more resistance and health. On dps champs it just lets them kill a little faster, but not much. The 8% AD/AP really helps bursty snowball champs.

Most champs only get AD ratio from *bonus* AD (besides on-hit). So you get nothing from it without AD item.

For AP, 190g is ~11 AP w/ the 435g book, 11/0.08=150 AP. The new buff is actually weaker for the first 15 mins.

I suppose it would make a bigger difference for AP than AD, since that's an extra 40 AP once you reach 500 outside the bonus, but that would still only happen a good deal into the game, after any snowballing might have happened.

You have to look at it by the numbers. When most players get that first buff usually they have about what 100 ad/Ap. so by getting that first buff you are only getting about 8 actually damage increase. Its a buff that scales well and should be gotten early so you can feel the full effect. When you complete that IE you get an additional ~8 ad or that Deathcap you get ~9 AP. Its really not that much in the grand scheme of things. I could do a lot more with a couple of the other buffs than having and additional 8 ad as an ADC.
It isn't an additional 8 damage. Katarina has 250% AP and 375% AD ratios on ult. That means her ult damage increases by 50% from ratios alone. That's actually pretty huge.

Katarina scales off of 375% BONUS attack damage, meaning this does not scale off of the total attack damage she has, just whatever she's gotten from items, buffs, etc.

Alright, let's say that before the 8% AP/AD bonus from dragon, Katarina has 100 AP and 100 AD and has not purchased any items that grant her AD. That means her scaled damage will be 250 AP and 0 AD for her ultimate (since her ulti only scales off of bonus AD, not base), for a total of 250 bonus damage on top of her base damage.

Now, add the 8% AP/AD bonus from dragon. Katarina now has 108 AP and 108 AD. This changes her scaled damage to 270 AP and 30 AD (375% of the 8 bonus AD she would get from dragon) for her ultimate, for a combined total of 300 bonus damage on top of her base damage.

In other words, the difference in bonus damage on the ultimate between a Katarina with and a Katarina without the damage boosts from dragon is only 50 points, NOT 50%. If you take into the account of her ulti's base damage at level 6, it's barely an 8% increase in damage (400 base + 250 = 650 without dragon; 400 base + 300 = 700 with dragon; 700/650 = 1.0769, which means damage increases by roughly 7.69%).

tl;dr Your math is bad and you should feel bad.
To his credit, I can see why he made that mistake. I suppose he forgot her ult only scaled with bonus AD.

This is around level 6-8 depending on lane, now at this time most champs will have around 100 ad or about 120ap.  Getting dragon buff then gives them literally 8 extra ad or 9.6 extra ap about the same as a dorans item. Which you were about able to buy off dragon before changes give or take a few minions. Early it means little to nothing, later is when it starts to matter. For people saying 8% increased dmg does nothing early:

Katarina has 250% AP and 375% AD ratios on ult. That means her ult damage increases by 50% from ratios alone. That's actually pretty huge.

250% of 8% is effectively +20% to the AP ratio, making it 270% instead of 250%.
375% of 8% is effectively +30% to the AD ratio, making it 405% instead of 375%.

The total damage increase *is still +8%* and the ratio increase can only be considered +50% if you have the same amount of AP and bonus AD (which will never realistically happen)

Ok I've been seeing a few threads about how the first dragon buff is stupidly strong for the first benchmark, and while I don't disagree, there is a reason riot put it first. It's for the sake of fairness to both teams.  Lets go with the idea of switching the third and first dragon buff for hypothetical reasons. Say in a game one team has been hoarding dragons over the other, and taken every one up to the third buff. They now have gained a massive power increase, while the other team is pretty much starved. Having the damage buff being third, it would take the other team three more dragons (which in near impossible to reach in game time) to reach that same level of power, items and lvl's aside. However, with it being the first buff like it is on live, they only need to get dragon one time to be on par, which is completely manageable at any point in the game. The reason it's first is because its the one buff that shouldn't decide the match.

To all the people saying that the 8% means nothing early, then why does the team that gets it first usually snowball consistently?  It may only be 8 AD or 10 AP, but thats something, and the fact is that they get it immediately, they don't have to back and spend gold.  So, if a team gets first drag and then the other team comes in to fight them, they are that much stronger than them right then, they don't even have to base and buy

To all the people saying that first team that take dragon wins.
You don't usually just take dragon whenever you feel like it. It usually happens when bot or mid lane is winning. So it isn't dragon that is giving the advantage, it's the lanes themselves. 

The buffs do help but are far from snowballie. If you convert the buffs into raw gold you will see it really isn't worth the risk. And the unconverted buffs are more of QoL buffs anyway.

There are many other junglers who can solo dragon pre 6 mins so pantheon isnt the only case

It would have made more sense to have the minion/monster damage buff as first indeed.
